title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
UNACCEPTABLE: CONTAINS NOTHING THAT EARNS CREDIT

· Mere restatement of the prompt

· Clearly does not respond to the prompt

· Not in Japanese

· Blank

VERY WEAK: DEMONSTRATES LACK OF COMPETENCE IN PRESENTATIONAL WRITING

· Task Completion

- Article addresses prompt only minimally

- Lacks organization and coherence

· Delivery

- Labored expression constantly interferes with comprehensibility

- Errors in orthography and mechanics are very frequent or significantly interfere with readability

- Minimal use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

- Constant use of register and style inappropriate to situation

· Language Use

- Insufficient, inappropriate vocabulary and idioms constantly interfere with comprehensibility

- Limited control of grammatical and syntactic structures significantly interferes with comprehensibility or results in very fragmented language

WEAK: SUGGESTS LACK OF COMPETENCE IN PRESENTATIONAL WRITING

· Task Completion

- Article addresses topic only marginally or addresses only some aspects of prompt

- Scattered information generally lacks organization and coherence; minimal or no use of transitional elements and cohesive devices

· Delivery

- Labored expression frequently interferes with comprehensibility

- Errors in orthography and mechanics are frequent or interfere with readability

- Frequent mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

- Frequent use of register and style inappropriate to situation

· Language Use

- Insufficient, inappropriate vocabulary and idioms frequently interfere with comprehensibility

- Limited control of grammatical and syntactic structures frequently interferes with comprehensibility or results in fragmented language

ADEQUATE: SUGGESTS EMERGING COMPETENCE IN PRESENTATIONAL WRITING

· Task Completion

- Article addresses topic directly but may not address all aspects of prompt

- Portions may lack organization or coherence; infrequent use of transitional elements and cohesive devices

· Delivery

- Strained or unnatural flow of expression sometimes interferes with comprehensibility

- Errors in orthography and mechanics may be frequent or interfere with readability

- May include frequent mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

- Use of register and style appropriate to situation is inconsistent or includes many errors

· Language Use

- Some inappropriate vocabulary and idioms interfere with comprehensibility

- Errors in grammatical and syntactic structures sometimes interfere with comprehensibility

GOOD: DEMONSTRATES COMPETENCE IN PRESENTATIONAL WRITING

· Task Completion

- Article addresses all aspects of prompt, including expression of preference and reasoning, but may lack detail or elaboration

- Generally organized and coherent; use of transitional elements and cohesive devices may be inconsistent

· Delivery

- Strained or unnatural flow of expression does not interfere with comprehensibility

- Errors in orthography and mechanics do not interfere with readability

- May include several mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

- May include several lapses in otherwise consistent use of register and style appropriate to situation

· Language Use

- Appropriate but limited vocabulary and idioms

- Appropriate use of grammatical and syntactic structures, but with several errors in complex structures or limited to simple structures

VERY GOOD: SUGGESTS EMERGING EXCELLENCE IN PRESENTATIONAL WRITING

· Task Completion

- Article addresses all aspects of prompt, including expression of preference and reasoning

- Well organized and coherent, with a progression of ideas that is generally clear; some use of transitional elements and cohesive devices

· Delivery

- Generally exhibits ease of expression

- Infrequent or insignificant errors in orthography and mechanics

- Occasional mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

- Consistent use of register and style appropriate to situation, except for occasional lapses

· Language Use

- Variety of vocabulary and idioms, with sporadic errors

- Appropriate use of grammatical and syntactic structures, with sporadic errors in complex structures

EXCELLENT: DEMONSTRATES EXCELLENCE IN PRESENTATIONAL WRITING

· Task Completion

- Article addresses all aspects of prompt with thoroughness and detail, including expression of preference and reasoning

- Well organized and coherent, with a clear progression of ideas; use of appropriate transitional elements and cohesive devices

· Delivery

- Natural, easily flowing expression

- Orthography and mechanics are virtually error-free

- Virtually no mistakes in use of kanji according to the AP Japanese kanji list

- Consistent use of register and style appropriate to situation

· Language Use

- Rich vocabulary and idioms

- Variety of appropriate grammatical and syntactic structures, with minimal or no errors
